result.execSummary:
The defendant Sergio A. Lopez-Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sergio A. Lopez-Perez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sergio A. Lopez-Perez was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.   Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $   TBD   plus surcharges.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with TLB (10/26/08), unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Comply w/ Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Progrm;  Do not enter US w/o proper documentation of lawful presence;  Report to Probation/Parole Agent w/n 72 hours of entry, legal or illegal into US;  Report any changes in immigration status to the probation agent w/n 72 hours;  Contact parole agent w/n 24 hrs of release from ICE custody w/n the US.  No contact w/ minors w/o permission of supervising agent.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for 3/18/16 sentencing paid by county $22.00.
DOC37 Restitution $0.00. No response from the victim/victim's parent.
Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge
32 years WSP; 25 yrs Initial followed by 7 yrs ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Interpreter Leo Martin in court.  Clerk: PT
Interpreter Martin is sworn in.  Sentencing arguments made.   Defendant is sentenced to 32 years in the WSP forthwith;  25 years Initial Confinement followed by 7 years of Extended Supervision. Credit for 269 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample.  No contact with T.L.B. (10/26/08) without permission of the court or any minors without permission of the supervising agent.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.   Amended court record - Restitution is to be determined by DOC (jk)
Interpreter Request sent to jury clerk for hearing on 3/18/16.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Interpreter, Leo Martin in court.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rose states requests an adjournment as he needs Interpreter to read PSI to defendant since PSI is not in spanish.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared in custody with Atty Terry Rose and assisted by Spanish interpreter Leo Martin.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 2 through 8 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 3/2/16 at 10:00.  Bond continued.
State's Motions in Limine filed by ADA Emily Trigg

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) and assisted by Spanish interpreter Leo Martin.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Ludwig hearing held; def. rejects the State's plea offer.  Jury trial 1/19/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Terry Rose and assisted by Spanish interpreter Alberto Aguilar.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Per Atty Rose, motion to suppress statements is withdrawn.  Case remains on for JSH 1/14/16 at 1:00 and JT 1/19/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

State's Response to Deft's Motion to Suppress
Submitted by ADA Emily Trigg
to suppress evidence; filed by Atty T Rose.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose & court ordered Spanish interpreter Alberto Aguilar.  The interpreter was sworn in.  Atty. Rose is requesting to review any written notes that may have be discovery.  The court orders that any written notes are to be turned over to Atty. Rose.  The trial remains on the calendar for 1/19/16 @ 8:30.  The DE should be brought over on 1/14/16 @ 1:00 per Judge Kerkman.  A Spanish interpreter has been requested.  Clerk D. Smith.
Discovery Motion and Affidavit of Service by Facsimile, filed by Atty Terry Rose.  (Hearing 12/22/15 at 10:00.)
Regarding Use of Video Taped Statements filed by Atty Terry Rose
State's Notice to Submit Deoxyribonucleic Acide (DNA) Profile Evidence at Trial to Prove or Disprove Identity filed by ADA Trigg

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Emitly Trigg

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Interpreter Leo Martin in court.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved and scheduling order is given to parties.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Interpreter requeted for hearing on 10/9/15 at 9AM

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Sergio A. Lopez-Perez, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Interpreter Alberto Aguilar in court.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rose states they have a proposal to consider and requests additional time to consider the offer; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sergio A. Lopez-Perez
Current: HC-FN25, c/o KENOSHA COUNTY JAIL,   (Effective: 08-03-2015)
Prior: 6418 21st Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53140
Interpreter canceled for 9/9/15 and requested for hearing on 9/18/15 at 9:00 AM.  New date confirmed with Atty Rose.
Email correspondence received from DA's Office requesting hearing be moved to ADA Trigg's week as she has been assigned to this case.

1:29 pm    Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Interpreter - Susan Schwigert.  Clerk:  NJ.  Referred to Br. 8 for further disposition on 9-9-15 @ 9:30 am.  Informationfiled, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Jury Demand.  Arguments heard on Atty Rose's bond motion; State objects to any modification of conditions - denied.
Bond Motion and Affidavit of Service by Facsimile filed by Atty Terry Rose.  (Hearing 7/28/15 at 1:00.)

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Terry Rose and Int. Leo Martin. Clerk LE.  KPD Det. David May sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Rose. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information not filed. Arraignment on 7-28-15 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.

222pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk LE.  Interpreter Leo Martin.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 7/2/15 @ 845am   Interpreter required.  $100,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*No Contact w/TLB (dob 10/26/08), Meisha L, or their residences.  *No Contact w/minor children under the age of 18 or their residences.
